name: phosphonic acid, 1,2-ethanediylbis-
Reason: 1,2-Ethanediylbisphosphonic acid has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base of ethyl vinyl ether, which has a melting point of -10 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for our comparison will be ethyl vinyl ether. The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of two additional phenyl rings. Phenyl groups, when connected to a benzene ring, tend to increase the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. In the case of 1,2-ethanediylbisphosphonic acid, we have two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion, which would notably augment the melting point. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight. Additionally, the phosphonic acid group introduces a rigid structure with potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20°C. The ethyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and increased molecular volume, estimated at around -5°C.
